statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Richmond 82, Charleston Southern 71
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Darien Brothers scored 15 points to lead four Richmond players in double figures in an 82-71 win over Charleston Southern on Sunday. The Spiders (3-1) shot 63.8 percent from the field (30 of 47) in the Chicago Invitational game, finding the efficiency on 17 assists, compared to just 11 turnovers. Kevin Anderson added 14 points, Justin Harper 12 and Francis-Cedric Martel 11 for Richmond, which never trailed. The Spiders led 45-30 at halftime and 51-43 with 16:11 left to play, before the Buccaneers (2-2) brought it to 53-50 with 13:34 left. Richmond responded with 17 straight points to go up 70-50 on Josh Duinker's 3-pointer with 9:04 remaining. Jamarco Warren led Charleston Southern with 21 points. Jeremy Sexton added 17 and Sheldon Strickland 12 as the Buccaneers' two-game winning streak ended.
